710061f-c.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 4th Street (West)
710061f-c.text:
Eiohth Avenue, north from W. 4th Street (left, and upon
which appears a view fror Horatio to 13th Street), showing in
the background the New York Port Authority Building and the
d6249  Mumens Trust Co. Buildira on opoosite sides of this thorough-
fare. View No. 2 emphasizes bhe latter and is in a north east-
ward direction.
A pecularity of the low foreground structures is that
those to the left of the bed bear Nos. 1 and 3 Horatio Street,
extending to 4th Street and those to the right, bear No's 51
to 63 Eiohth Avenue, proceeding to 13th Street.
July 31, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr
(3)
A view lfriited to the foreground of View 2, showing solely
that irregular triangular block between Horatio and W. 13th Streets.
At the left is the terrination of West 4th Street.

710926f-a.title: Manhattan: 4th Street - Jane Street
710926f-a.text:
4th Street, east side, from Jane to 12th Streets, inclusive, seen
from Eighth Avenue and 4th Streets.
The house on the S.E. corner of Jane Street, which used to be wooden
with a stone front, tas been rebuilt since 1930.
March 12, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

710059f-b.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - Jane Street
710059f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, south from Jane Street to Abingdon Square. On
the right is the west frontage that extends to W. 12th Street.
U)pon the latter was erected (1931) the modern 20-story apartment
house, No. 299 W. 12th Street. View 2 is limited to this block and
its new structure. On the right is south side of Jane Street ex-
tneding westward to Hudson Street.
May 30, 1929
March 9, 1933
P. L. Sperr

720679f-a.title: Manhattan: Jane Street - 8th Avenue
720679f-a.text:
30 to 2 Jane Street, south side, from east of 4th Street and
Eighth Avenue to and includirg Greenwich Avenue, and showing 102-98
Greenwich Avenus.
July 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
Nos. 16 and 18 (the 2 five-story tenements adjoining the garage)
(No. 10-14) after an ownership of 60 years by the Edward Brown Estate
have been sold and will be extensively altered according to the New
York Times of April 12, 1938.
